snippet: The leader of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, took the all but unprecedented step of delivering a videotaped sermon at a mosque in Mosul.
abstract: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria releases 21-minute video of its leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi delivering a public sermon in Mosul, Iraq; until video release, he has been all but invisible, seemingly reluctant to risk a public appearance as his group grew in strength and he became the United States' second-most sought-after terrorist; US is offering a $10 million reward for information leading to his capture.

byline.contributor: An Iraqi employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Mosul, Michael R. Gordon from Washington, and Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran.

lead_paragraph: The leader of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, took the all but unprecedented step of delivering a videotaped sermon at a mosque in Mosul.

headline.main: Militant Leader in Rare Appearance in Iraq
headline.print_headline: Militant Leader in Rare Appearance in Iraq

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
